panels.description: Shows if the NUT driver is connected to the UPS. CONNECTED means data is being received, WAITING means the driver has lost connection or is stale.
panels.title: Driver

panels.description: Current power source. ONLINE means powered from mains/wall outlet. OFFLINE means no mains power detected.
panels.title: Power Status

panels.description: Indicates if the UPS is currently running on battery power due to a mains power failure.
panels.title: On Battery

panels.description: Critical warning - battery charge is critically low.
panels.title: Low Battery

panels.description: UPS alarm is active - check for issues.
panels.title: Alarm

panels.description: Indicates if the battery is actively being charged.
panels.title: Charging

panels.description: Battery is discharging (running on battery power).
panels.title: Discharging

panels.description: UPS is in bypass mode (no battery protection).
panels.title: Bypass

panels.description: Current battery charge level as a percentage.
panels.title: Battery Charge

panels.description: Current power draw as percentage of UPS capacity.
panels.title: UPS Load

panels.description: Output power as percentage of capacity.
panels.title: Output Power %

panels.description: Input and output voltage over time.
panels.title: Voltage History

panels.description: Battery charge and UPS load over time.
panels.title: Battery & Load History

panels.description: UPS and battery temperatures over time.
panels.title: Temperature History
